page.title: 04A Farm in Whitley
page.content: The farm, of 150acres, is called Crimwellpool.It is worth around Â£2000 per acre.The animals they have are 40 milking cows,60 followers and one bull. They are all Pedigree British Friesians. They have 60 Pedigree Large White pigs, 24 hens and one dog. They grow wheat, barley,root-crops,potatoes and grass.There are 90 acres of grass, 40 acres of cereals and 20 acres of potatoes and roots. The grass is used for grazing from Spring to Autumn and for making hay to feed to cattle in winter. The Barley is stored and milled at the farm to feed the cattle in winter. Wheat is sold for either biscuit making or animal food.Potatoes are sold to local markets and the root crops grown to feed cattle in winter. It was once part of the large Walton Estate which was broken up and sold to tenant farmers in 1941 for Â£50 an acre
